intro: Tithymalus helioscopioides, commonly known as the sun-leaf or sunflower-like plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with narrow, leathery leaves and showy yellow to orange flowers. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it a hardy species suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in gardens, particularly in regions with warm climates.
